title: Passive Voice in Present and Past Tenses

questions.question: What is the structure of the passive voice?
questions.answer: Subject + be + past participle

questions.question: Which sentence is in the passive voice (present simple)?
choices: The meal is cooked by the chef.
The chef is cooking the meal.
The meal was cooked by the chef.
questions.answer: The meal is cooked by the chef.

questions.question: How do you form the passive voice in the past simple tense?
questions.answer: was/were + past participle

questions.question: Which sentence is in the passive voice (past simple)?
choices: The company will launch the product next month.
The product will be launched by the company next month.
The company launched the product last month.
The product was launched by the company last month.
questions.answer: The product was launched by the company last month.

questions.question: When is the passive voice commonly used?
choices: When the doer of the action is unknown or unimportant
When we want to emphasize the doer of the action
questions.answer: When the doer of the action is unknown or unimportant

questions.question: How do you change an active sentence to passive when there are two objects?
choices: Either object can be the subject of the passive sentence
Only the direct object can be the subject of the passive sentence
Only the indirect object can be the subject of the passive sentence
You cannot change sentences with two objects into passive voice
questions.answer: Either object can be the subject of the passive sentence

questions.question: Which sentence is the correct passive form of 'Someone has stolen my bike'?
questions.answer: My bike has been stolen.

questions.question: In passive sentences, where do you put the agent (doer of the action)?
choices: At the end of the sentence, introduced by 'by'
At the beginning of the sentence
questions.answer: At the end of the sentence, introduced by 'by'

questions.question: Which verb cannot be used in the passive voice?
questions.answer: Happen

questions.question: What is the correct passive form of 'They are repairing the road'?
questions.answer: The road is being repaired.

questions.question: Which tense is used in this passive sentence: 'The letter was being written when the pen ran out of ink'?
questions.answer: Past continuous

questions.question: How do you form a question in the passive voice?
choices: Invert the subject and the first auxiliary verb
Change the verb to past participle
Add 'by' at the end of the sentence
questions.answer: Invert the subject and the first auxiliary verb

questions.question: Which sentence is the correct passive question form?
choices: Was the letter written by John?
Did the letter write by John?
The letter was written by John?
By John was the letter written?
questions.answer: Was the letter written by John?

questions.question: What is the correct passive form of 'People speak English all over the world'?
choices: English is spoken all over the world.
English speaks all over the world.
English was spoken all over the world.
English has spoken all over the world.
questions.answer: English is spoken all over the world.

questions.question: In which situation would you use the active voice instead of passive?
choices: When the doer of the action is important or needs to be emphasized
When the doer of the action is unknown
questions.answer: When the doer of the action is important or needs to be emphasized

questions.question: What is the correct passive form of 'I will send the email tomorrow'?
choices: The email will be sent tomorrow.
The email is going to be sent tomorrow.
questions.answer: The email will be sent tomorrow.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the active voice?
choices: The cake was baked by my mother.
questions.answer: My mother baked the cake.

questions.question: What's the function of 'by' in passive sentences?
choices: To introduce the agent or doer of the action
questions.answer: To introduce the agent or doer of the action

questions.question: Which of these verbs is most commonly used in the passive voice?
questions.answer: Born

questions.question: What's the correct passive form of 'They had already eaten dinner when I arrived'?
choices: Dinner had already been eaten when I arrived.
Dinner was already eaten when I arrived.
Dinner has already been eaten when I arrived.
Dinner had already eat when I arrived.
questions.answer: Dinner had already been eaten when I arrived.
